ovdesc.p: The MG.BALANCES file records all the financial movement and balance details of a loan within the MORTGAGE module. Both current and historical data are maintained providing a means by which the system can control and record all financial transactions. This file also provides a valuable source of information for enquiry and reporting purposes for both bank and customer requirements.

An MG.BALANCES record is created whenever a contract is entered into the system and remains there as long as the contract remains on the "Live" MG.MORTGAGE file. It is updated automatically by any routines which modify contract financial data or produce financial transactions. There is no facility for direct input to this file.
The information retained on this file can be grouped into sections as follows:
1. Type, balance and interest rate. (fields CONTRACT.TYPE to INT.RATE)

This group of multivalued fields records changes in the product type, the principal balance and the interest rate applicable throughout the life of a contract. Whenever one of these changes, the new value along with its effective date, will be recorded in the relevant fields. This information is stored in reverse chronological order, i.e. the most recent or current value will always be found in the first multivalue of the relevant field.
2. Record start date. (RECORD.START.DATE)

This field records the earliest date from which information is retained on the current record, This is explained in greater detail later in the archiving and MG.BALANCES.HIST section of this overview.
3. Current interest period details. (fields START.INT.PERIOD to OTS.INT.ADJUST)

Fields START.INT.PERIOD and END.INT.PERIOD define the start and end of the current interest period. Field OTS.INTEREST records the amount of outstanding interest accrued in the current interest period.
4. Interest accrual details. (fields ACCR.FROM.DATE to ACCR.ACT.AMT)

This set of multivalued fields record all interest accrual details, i.e. principal rate no. of days and amount, for both the current and previous interest periods. These details are stored in reverse chronological order, ie. details pertaining to the most recent accrual will always be found in the first multivalue of each field.
5. Repayment totals. (fields TOT.INTEREST.RCVD to REPAYMENTS.MADE)

This group of fields records the total amounts of repayments of principal, interest and any additional payment elements received on the contract to date. This includes both automatic scheduled repayments and manual principal redemptions made via the MG.PAYMENT application. The total number of scheduled repayments made is also recorded here.
6. Repayment details. (fields PAYMENT.DATE to ADD.PAY.5.RCVD)

This group of multivalue fields records the details of each individual repayment made on a contract. This includes both automatic scheduled repayments and manual principal redemptions made via the MG.PAYMENT application. Details of payment date, total repayment amount, as well as the breakdown of the individual repayment elements, are stored. In the case of manual redemptions the payment number of the originating MG.PAYMENT record is recorded. All payment details are recorded in reverse chronological order, i.e. details of the most recent payment will always be in the first multivalue of each field.
7. Accrual accounting entries. (field ENTRY.IDS)
This field records the category entry IDs of all entries relating to interest accruals.
Archiving and the MG.BALANCES.HIST file.
Because of the amount of data retained on this file and the possible longevity of the contract, data from this file may be periodically archived to the MG.BALANCES.HIST file.

Archiving is performed on a yearly basis and generates records on the MG.BALANCES.HIST file with an ID comprising of the contract number and the year to which data on that record relates. It is therefore possible to have several MG.BALANCES.HIST records for one contract.

The number of years' data retained on the "Live" balances file is controlled by a user definable parameter on the MG.PARAMETER table. When setting this parameter consideration should be given to reporting requirements such as the customer's obligations to the local tax authorities. It is also important to note that back-valued adjustments and corrections cannot be made prior to the record start date of the "Live" balances record.

The date from which data is recorded on the "Live" record and on each of the "History" records is recorded in the RECORD.START.DATE field on each record. Therefore, data prior to the date in this field will not be available on the record being viewed and the relevant "History" record should be enquired upon.
The layout of the MG.BALANCES.HIST file is identical to that of the MG.BALANCES file and this file may be enquired on via the MG.BALANCES.HIST application.

Once a contract matures, the MG.BALANCES record will automatically be moved to the MG.BALANCES.HIST file after a period of time. This live file retention period is user definable via the MG.PARAMETER table.

This is the same ID that is used on the main file MG.MORTGAGE and is the identifier assigned to each contract at first input.

The set of fields ACCR.FROM.DATE to ACCR.ACT.AMT form the multivalue set of interest accrual fields. These fields record all details of interest accrued on the contract. A new group is created each time one of the accrual parameters, i.e. outstanding principal or interest rate, changes, or a month end has been reached.

This field records the amount of accrued interest, rounded to the correct number of decimal places for the currency of the loan, for each of the accrual groups. This amount is accumulated for each interest period and recorded in the OTS.INTEREST field which then determines the amount of interest to be paid at the end of the interest period.

Interest is accrued to four decimal places and then rounded in such a way that the error in rounding is kept to a minimum. The four decimal place un-rounded amounts are held in the associated ACTUAL.ACCR.AMT field. Any rounding error from a given accrual group is carried forward via the un-rounded accrual amount of the following group. However, this is only true if the following group forms part of the same interest period. As with all other multivalue fields on this file the accrual groups are stored in reverse chronological order.
The method of rounding is best illustrated by the following example.

This procedure is repeated for the next group:
Less the rounded amount this period: 92.0444 - 17.26 - 74.78 ------------- 83.4988
This amount is then rounded to give the ACCR.AMT for the group of 83.45

This field contains the amount of interest accrued for the multivalue accrual group in question, rounded to the number of decimal places of the currency of the contract. The set of fields ACCR.FROM.DATE to ACCR.ACT.AMT form the multivalue set of interest accrual fields. These fields record all details of interest accrued on the contract. A new group is created each time one of the accrual parameters, i.e. outstanding principal or interest rate, changes, or a month end has been reached. This field records the amount of accrued interest, rounded to the correct number of decimal places for the currency of the loan, for each of the accrual groups. This amount is accumulated for each interest period and recorded in the OTS.INTEREST field which then determines the amount of interest to be paid at the end of the interest period. Interest is accrued to four decimal places and then rounded in such a way that the error in rounding is kept to a minimum. The four decimal place un-rounded amounts are held in the associated ACTUAL.ACCR.AMT field. Any rounding error from a given accrual group is carried forward via the un-rounded accrual amount of the following group. However, this is only true if the following group forms part of the same interest period. As with all other multivalue fields on this file the accrual groups are stored in reverse chronological order. The method of rounding is best illustrated by the following example. Example : The following shows the accrual details on a contract with repayments on the 28th of each month with an interest rate change from 10.9% to 11.3% on 13/10/90. Accruals are shown from 28/09/90 to 27/10/90 which represents one complete interest period. The currency of the contract is pounds sterling which has two decimal places. ACCR.PRINCIPAL : 19000 19000.00 19000.00 ACCR.RATE : 11.3% 10.9% 10.9% ACCR.FROM.DATE : 14/10/90 01/10/90 28/09/90 ACCR.TO.DATE : 27/10/90 13/10/90 30/09/90 ACCR.DAYS : 14 13 3 ACCR.AMT : 83.50 74.78 17.26 ACCR.ACT.AMT : 83.4944 74.7861 17.2583 After the ACTUAL.ACCR.AMT has been calculated for the period 01/10 to 13/10 the following calculation is made to obtain the ACCR.AMT for the group: Total un-rounded accrual this period: 17.2583 + 74.7861 --------- 92.0444 Less the rounded amount this period: 92.0444 - 17.26 --------- 74.7844 This amount is then rounded to give the ACCR.AMT for the group of 74.78. This procedure is repeated for the next group: Total un-rounded accrual this period: 17.2583 + 74.7861 + 83.4944 -------------- 175.5388 Less the rounded amount this period: 92.0444 - 17.26 - 74.78 ------------- 83.4988 This amount is then rounded to give the ACCR.AMT for the group of 83.45 The total rounded amount for the period is then: 17.26 + 74.78 + 83.45 ----------- 175.49 This compares with the un-rounded total of 175.5388.

This field records the entry IDs of all category entries raised by the interest accrual processing. Whenever interest is accrued by the end of day accrual processing routines the IDs of any category entries raised will be recorded in this field. These IDs consist of two parts, a date-time stamp and a sequence number. All entries raised by a given transaction, ie a specific interest accrual, will have the same date-time stamp but different sequence numbers. Whenever an interest accrual takes place the IDs of the category entries generated are recorded in a new multivalue of this field. This multivalue also has subvalues. The first subvalue records the date-time stamp of the entries and the sequence numbers are recorded in the third. In all cases the second subvalue is left blank. The entry IDs are stored in this field in reverse chronological order. This means that the IDs for the most recently generated category entries are always in the first multivalue. The use of this field is illustrated in the following example: Example: At month end interest will be accrued on all contracts up to the month end date. The IDs of the category entries raised will be recorded as follows: 39.1.1 ENTRY.ID ............. 673732684.48 39.1.2 ENTRY.ID ............. 39.1.3 ENTRY.ID ............. 1 The number automatically generated in Field 39.1.1 is unique to the contract and accrual in question and is built in the following way: 1. The first four digits '6737' indicate the number of days since the 1st of January 1968. In our example it corresponds to the 11th of June 1986. 2. The next five digits '32684' indicate the number of seconds since midnight. In our example it corresponds to an entry generated on line at 09:04:44 AM. 3. The last two digits '48' indicate the number of hundreds of seconds. The sequence number in field 39.1.3 identifies the entry as a category entry and indicates that only one entry was raised. This entry may be viewed via the CATEG.ENTRY application using the following ID: 673732684.480001

The types that have applied to the current loan are held in the associated field CONTRACT.TYPE. This field identifies the dates on which these types became effective. Information is stored in these fields in reverse chronological order, i.e. the most recent effective date will always be found in the first multivalue. It should be noted that this field will only contain data relating to the contract after the date held in the RECORD.START.DATE field. Any data prior to this may be found on the MG.BALANCES.HIST file.

Records the total amount of the fourth additional payment element, defined in the the ADD.PAY.TYPE field on the MG.PARAMETER table, paid on the contract to date.

It is possible to define additional payment elements to be repaid on a periodic basis along with the normal repayments of principal and interest. These types are defined on the MG.PARAMETER table. Up to five different types may be created. This field records the total amount of the fourth additional element defined in the ADD.PAY.TYPE field of the MG.PARAMETER table, received on the contract to date. Whenever a repayment of this additional payment element is made the amount received will be added into this field.

It should be noted that the name of this field will be modified to incorporate the name of the additional payment as defined on the MG.TYPE.TEXT file. For example, if the fourth additional payment element defined on the MG.PARAMETER table has a description of "PREMIUM A" on the MG.TYPE.TEXT file then this field will have the name TOT.PREMIUM.A.RCVD.

A breakdown of the payments of this additional element received on each individual repayment can be found in the multivalued ADD.PAY.4.RCVD field. However, because it is possible to archive data from this record the total of all multivalues in the ADD.PAY.4.RCVD field may not equal the total amount recorded in this field.
